intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium permixtum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils, and it can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of yellow disk florets surrounded by pale yellow to reddish ray florets. Hieracium permixtum is often considered a weed due to its aggressive growth and ability to spread rapidly.
